intro: Elaphrium ariense, commonly known as the Armenian elaphrium, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the mountainous regions of Armenia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky soils at high altitudes, showcasing adaptability to harsh environmental conditions. Its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers contribute to its unique botanical appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Elaphrium ariense is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
